title: 60's Era Safeway Typeface...
content:
What typeface is this that Safeway used for signage in the 1960’s? I always thought it was a light version of American Typewriter, but that’s wrong...

(Referring to the PRODUCE typeface) [http://farm4.static.flickr.com/3119/2626336447\_de7c12ebc6.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121175820/http:/farm4.static.flickr.com/3119/2626336447_de7c12ebc6.jpg "http://farm4.static.flickr.com/3119/2626336447\_de7c12ebc6.jpg")

 [‹ Cafe font](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121175820/http:/www.typophile.com/node/48132 "Go to previous forum topic") [Looking for this Roger Dean "Yes" font ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121175820/http:/www.typophile.com/node/43630 "Go to next forum topic")
author: rmfernandez

comments.content:
First thing that comes to mind is the light weight of FF Zapata, but that is not it.

Also close are:  
 [Archive Antique Extended](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121175820/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/archivetype/archive-antique-extended/) + distress  
 [58 Rodeo](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121175820/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/baselinefonts/58-rodeo/)

or any other extended Clarendon-ish typeface.
